title: Strictly's Neil Jones 'needs to hurry up and recover' after nasty injury
text:
Neil wants to hurry up and recover in time to perform with Alex this weekend (Picture: BBC)

Neil Jones is keeping his fingers crossed to return to Strictly Come Dancing this weekend after mystery injury forced him out of last week’s show.

Alex Scott was forced to dance with Kevin Clifton with just a one hour turnaround on Saturday night after Neil was injured performing their Ghostbusters street dance.

In leaked audio, Kevin was heard apologising to Alex as he messed up some of the routine despite his best efforts.

As fans check in on his recovery, the star has been updating fans with videos of what could have been from rehearsals as well as what the pair are lined-up to dance to this weekend.

Writing online after the song choice reveal, Neil said: ‘Yes I can’t wait this week myself @AlexScott will be dancing American Smooth to “Ain’t no mountain high enough”’

He then warned: ‘I just need to hurry up and recover.’

Alex and Neil are due to perform an American Smooth this weekend (Picture: BBC)

Yes I can’t wait this week myself @AlexScott will be dancing American Smooth to “Ain’t no mountain high enough” I just need to hurry up and recover — Neil Jones (@Mr_NJones) October 29, 2019

Neil’s message comes just days after he posted another message thanking Alex and Kevin for pushing forward without him, despite him being gutted he was unable to perform.

‘The moment I got injured all I could think about was Alex and wanting to push to dance with her no matter what,’ he wrote.

‘But she showed us all how much she has grown on @bbcstrictly with her performance and to think just 8 weeks ago she was a complete beginner.’

‘Alex listens to everything I teach her so now it’s my turn to listen to her, I will rest and recover ASAP so I can share the floor with my Partner,’ he added.

Alex has also sent her love and hopes for his recovery after filling in on BBC’s The One Show this weekend.

Neil isn’t the only star who was forced to pull out of performing last weekend, after Will Bayley collapsed in on his knee after jumping off a table.

Paralympian Will was given a bye through to next week in light of the injury – but he’s out if he can’t perform this upcoming week.

With no official comments made about the star’s injury or potential recovery time, it’s expected that an answer about his ability to perform with Janette Manrara will be announced today.

They are due to perform a waltz to Weekend in New England by Barry Manilow.

Strictly Come Dancing returns at 7.15pm on BBC One.
